newsitem.title: GREECE: Greek money rates dip on inflows, auction talk.
newsitem.headline: Greek money rates dip on inflows, auction talk.

text.p: Continued forex inflows with the opening of long drachma, short ecu positions accounted for a 10 basis point drop in Greek long money rates, helped by talk of no FRN auction by the finance ministry before September 22, traders said.

"Depo rates have eased 10 basis points in periods on rumours that there will be no FRN auction before the elections and the opening of long drachma, short ecu positions at the forex," said a foreign bank trader.
About 100 million Ecus were sold at the central bank's fixing, bankers said.
The central bank soaked overnight money at an unchanged 12.40 percent.
Early elections are to be held on September 22 but the market has taken a positive attitude towards them on the grounds that the winner will have no option but to follow Greece's EU convergence plan.
The mark was quoted at 159.65/75 drachmas from Tuesday's 159.695 fix, the dollar at 237.11/21 drachmas from 237.020 and the Ecu at 301.14/24 from 301.150 drachmas.
The National Bank of Greece, the domestic money market's biggest player, quoted the following late rates:
